definition:
A formal series of the form $$\sum_{n=m}^\infty a_n z^{n/k}$$ where $m$
and $k$ are integers such that $k \geq 1$ is is called a [*Puiseux
series*]{} or a [*fractional power series*]{}. Note that if $k > 1$,
then $z^{n/k}$ could be multivalued. One example of the use of such a
power series is the Puiseux parametrization of one-dimensional complex
analytic varieties.

[9]{} E. M. Chirka. [**]{}. Kluwer Academic Publishers, Dordrecht, The
Netherlands, 1989. Alexandru Dimca. [**]{}. Vieweg, Braunschweig,
Germany, 1987.
